summary: Success Test Series Hub — an exam preparation web app for UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, and State Exams. Includes free/paid test series, AI-powered question generator, top rankers leaderboard, exam categories, and a contact form. Now adding a login system and admin panel.
architectural_notes: Backend API endpoints expected: GET /tests (returns test list) and POST /ai/generate (returns AI-generated questions)
Payment integration is placeholder — buyPlan() currently shows alert, needs real payment gateway
Admin panel requires authentication — implement login with role-based access (admin vs. regular user)

existing_features.title: Build the full React frontend for Success Test Series Hub. Implement a sticky header with the uploaded logo (frontend/public/assets/generated/logo.dim_256x256.png) and app name, a navigation bar with anchor links to: Home, Exam Categories, Free Tests, Paid Tests, Top Rankers, and Contact sections. Include a footer with copyright '© 2026 Success Test Series Hub | Privacy Policy | Terms & Conditions'.

Implement a Hero section with the headline 'Start Free Test Now!', a subheadline 'Practice for UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, and State Exams', and a prominent 'Start Free Test' button that scrolls to the Free Tests section and triggers loading of available tests.

Implement an Exam Categories section displaying five category cards: UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, and State Exams. Each card is clickable and filters the free tests list to show only tests in that category.

Implement a Free Tests section that fetches tests from the backend using getTests() and displays each test as a card with its title, category badge, and an 'Attempt' button. When 'Attempt' is clicked, show a modal or inline test-taking interface that renders all questions with radio button answer options. After submission, show the user's score and correct answers.

Implement a Paid Test Series section with three plan cards: Basic (₹49), Standard (₹99), and Premium (₹199). Each card should list 2–3 bullet-point features appropriate to the plan tier. The 'Buy Now' button on each card should display an informational modal indicating that payment processing will be available soon.

Implement a 'Why Choose Us' section with four feature highlights: AI-Generated Questions, Adaptive Tests, Live Proctoring, and Detailed Analytics. Each highlight should have an icon, a short title, and a one-sentence description.

Implement a Top Rankers section that fetches leaderboard data from the backend using getTopRankers() and displays a ranked table or card list showing each ranker's rank, name, exam category, and score. Highlight the top 3 with gold, silver, and bronze styling.

Implement an AI-Powered Test Generator section with a textarea for entering a topic or passage, a difficulty level selector (Easy, Medium, Hard), and a 'Generate Questions' button. On click, call the backend generateQuestions() function and display the returned questions as formatted cards showing question text, multiple-choice options, and the correct answer.

Implement a Contact section with a form containing Name, Email, and Message fields. On submit, call the backend submitContact() function with the form data. Show a success confirmation message upon completion and reset the form.

Apply a cohesive dark navy and gold visual theme throughout the app, consistent with the uploaded logo's color palette (deep navy blue, bright sky-blue accent, gold). Use bold typography for headings, card-based layouts with subtle shadows, and a dark header/footer. Apply green for primary CTA buttons (matching the original design intent) and gold accents for rankings and highlights.

Create a standalone Admin Login page at route /admin. Render a centered login card with Username and Password fields and a 'Login' button. On submit, call the backend login() function. On success, store the session token in React state (or localStorage) and redirect to the Admin Dashboard. On failure, display an inline error message 'Invalid credentials'. Style the page to match the existing dark navy and gold theme.

Create an Admin Dashboard page at route /admin/dashboard, accessible only when a valid session token exists (redirect to /admin if not authenticated). Render a sidebar with navigation links: Tests, Rankers, Contact Submissions, and a Logout button. Logout calls the backend logout() function, clears the session token, and redirects to /admin.

Implement the Tests management panel in the Admin Dashboard. Display a table of all existing tests showing id, title, and category. Include an 'Add Test' button that opens a modal form with fields: Title, Category (dropdown: UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, State Exams), and a dynamic questions editor (add/remove questions, each with question text, four options, and correct answer selector). Include Edit and Delete actions per row. On save, call addTest() or updateTest(); on delete, call deleteTest(). Refresh the list after each mutation.

Implement the Rankers management panel in the Admin Dashboard. Display a ranked table of all rankers showing rank, studentName, examCategory, and score. Include an 'Add Ranker' button that opens a modal form with fields: Student Name, Exam Category (dropdown), and Score. Include a Delete action per row. On save, call addRanker(); on delete, call deleteRanker(). Refresh the leaderboard after each mutation.

Implement the Contact Submissions panel in the Admin Dashboard. Display a table of all contact form submissions showing name, email, message, and timestamp. Call getContactSubmissions() using the active session token to fetch data. Show a loading state while fetching. The table should be read-only (no edit or delete actions required).

new_feature_requests.summary: Hero section with Start Free Test button that loads tests from /tests API
Exam categories section (UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, State Exams)
Free test series section dynamically loaded from /tests endpoint
Paid test plans (Basic ₹49, Standard ₹99, Premium ₹199) with Buy Now buttons
Why Choose Us section highlighting AI questions, adaptive tests, proctoring, analytics
AI-powered test generator connecting to /ai/generate endpoint with topic input and difficulty level
Contact form with name, email, and message fields

Create a backend actor that stores and serves free test series data. Each test has an id, title, category (e.g., UPSC, BPSC, SSC, Railway, State Exams), and a list of questions (each with question text, options array, and correct answer). Seed the actor with at least 10 sample tests across categories. Expose query functions: getTests() returning all tests, getTestById(id) returning a single test with questions.

Create a backend actor function that accepts a topic string and difficulty level (easy, medium, hard) and returns a set of generated multiple-choice questions based on the topic. Since external AI APIs are not available, implement a template-based question generator that produces contextually relevant MCQs using the topic text and applies difficulty-appropriate question framing. Return an array of question objects each with: type, question, options, and answer fields.

Create a backend actor that stores contact form submissions. Each submission has name, email, and message fields with a timestamp. Expose a submitContact(name, email, message) update function that saves the entry.

Create a backend actor that stores a top rankers leaderboard. Each ranker entry has rank, studentName, examCategory, and score. Seed with at least 10 sample rankers. Expose getTopRankers() returning the sorted leaderboard.
Login system and admin panel for managing tests, rankers, contact submissions, and site content

Add backend support for admin authentication. Store a hardcoded admin username and password hash in the actor. Expose a login(username, password) update function that returns a session token (a random text token) on success, or an error on failure. Expose a validateSession(token) query that returns true if the token is active. Expose a logout(token) update function that invalidates the session token.

Add backend admin CRUD functions for tests. Expose addTest(token, title, category, questions) update that creates a new test (validates admin session first), updateTest(token, id, title, category, questions) update that modifies an existing test, and deleteTest(token, id) update that removes a test. All functions must reject with an error if the session token is invalid.

Add backend admin functions for managing the top rankers leaderboard. Expose addRanker(token, studentName, examCategory, score) update and deleteRanker(token, rank) update. Re-sort and re-rank entries after each mutation. All functions must validate the admin session token and reject with an error if invalid.
Add a backend query function getContactSubmissions(token) that returns all stored contact form submissions. Must validate the admin session token and return an error if invalid.

Add client-side routing to the frontend application to support the /admin and /admin/dashboard routes. Use React Router. The existing single-page app layout (App.tsx) should continue to render at the root route /. The /admin route should render the Admin Login page and /admin/dashboard should render the Admin Dashboard. Do not alter the existing public-facing page sections.
